Instruction: Update the table in the file XG72K.pdf, on page 5, in the 3rd rectangle. Arrange the table with row heights [25, 20, 20] and uniform column width of 30. Set the font size to 12 and alignment to center.
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1
# File
filepath = "XG72K.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 5
pagenumber = 4  # Page 5 corresponds to 4 in zero-based indexing
# Rectangle 3
rectangleorder = 2  # Third rectangle corresponds to 2 in zero-based indexing

# Extract the target rectangle
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Arguments for table update
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    arrange=[[25, 20, 20], [30]],  # Row heights and uniform column width
    fontsize=12,
    align="center"
)

# Extract the original table
table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))
table_data = table_extractor.data

# Update the table
Table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=table_data,
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize"),
    align=argument.get("align")
)
doc = Table_manipulator.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File: BG37K.pdf
filepath = "BG37K.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Page 3: Missing order-level information for Rectangle 1
missing_information1 = "file-level: BG37K.pdf, page-level: 3, order-level: 1, base-level: missing"
recorder1 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_information1)
recorder1.recording()

# Page 3, Rectangle 5
pagenumber2 = 2  # Page 3 corresponds to 2 in zero-based indexing
rectangleorder2 = 4  # Fifth rectangle corresponds to 4 in zero-based indexing
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Arguments for Rectangle 5
argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle2,
    arrange=[None, [30, 30]],  # Column widths
    align="center"  # Alignment to center
)

# Extract table and update for Rectangle 5
table_extractor2 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber2, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
table_data2 = table_extractor2.data

Table_manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=table_data2,
    arrange=argument2.get("arrange"),
    align=argument2.get("align")
)
doc = Table_manipulator2.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)
